lines.text: [the Sheriff has said he'll cut out Robin Hood's heart with a spoon]
Why a spoon, cousin? Why not an axe?
Because it's DULL, you twit. It'll hurt more.
Just a minute. Robin Hood steals money from my pocket, forcing me to hurt the public, and they love him for it?
[Scribe nods]
That's it then. Cancel the kitchen scraps for lepers and orphans, no more merciful beheadings, and call off Christmas.
"There are no perfect men in the world; only perfect intentions."
30 tonight.
45... And bring a friend.
Salaam, little one.
Did God paint you?
Did God paint me?
[laughs]
For certain.
Why?
Because Allah loves wondrous varieties.
This is grain, which any fool can eat, but for which the Lord intended a more divine means of consumption. Let us give praise to our maker and glory to his bounty by learning about... BEER.

[after launching Robin and Azeem over the wall]
Fuck me, he cleared it!

English! English! Behold, Azeem Edin Bashir Al Bakir. I am not one of you, but I fight! I fight with Robin Hood. I fight against a tyrant who holds you under his boot! If you would be free men, then you must fight! Join us now, join Robin Hood!
By the power vested in me, of God's holy church, I say let any man who has reason why these two should not be joined, let him speak now or forever hold his peace.
[silence]
Then, I now pronounce you...
Hold, I speak!
[Everyone turns around to see knights coming]
Richard!
[Everyone, except Marian and a confused Azeem, bows]
I will not allow this wedding to proceed...

[gets up]
My lord...
...unless I'm allowed to give the bride away! You look radiant, cousin.
Oh, Richard.
[they exchange kisses on the cheeks]
I'm deeply honored, your majesty.
It is I who is honored, Lord Locksley. Thanks to you, I still have a throne. Friar, proceed!
Husband and wife. You may kiss the bride.
I know that.
[They kiss, and everyone cheers. The camera shifts to the Friar, who breaks the fourth wall and looks at the camera]
Now, get out of it! We're wasting good celebration time!
Is she worth it?
Worth dying for.
You're King Richard's cousin. You can give word to him of Nottingham's plans. He would believe you.
If the sheriff found out, I could lose all that I have.
But will you do it for your king?
No. I'll do it for you.
[She kisses him and gets on the boat. They look at each other intensely as the boat leaves]
He fancies you, my Lady. I may be blind, but there are some things I still see.
So, you sold your soul to Satan, Your Grace? You accused innocent men of witchcraft and let them die!
Brother Friar, you would not strike a fellow man of the cloth?
No, no, I wouldn't. In fact, I'll help you pack for your journey.
[weighs the Bishop down with several heavy sacks]
You're going to need lots of gold to help you on your way - you're a very rich man, eh? This too, and that!
[holds up one last bag]
Here's thirty pieces of silver, to pay the Devil... ON YOUR WAY TO HELL!
[shoves the Bishop to his death out a window]
[robbing a lady in a carriage]
Milady, a woman of your beauty has no need for such... decorations.
Where I come from, we talk to our women. We do not drug them with plants.
Locksley. I'll cut your heart out with a spoon.
Then it begins.
[Azeem shows Guy's approaching men with a telescope. Robin peers at it, bewildered]
How did your uneducated kind ever take Jerusalem?
[after escaping from the Turks' dungeon]
Why did you cut me free, Christian?
Whatever blood is in your veins, no man deserves to die in there.
What do you know of women?
Where I come from, Christian, there are women of such beauty, that they can possess a man's mind so that he would be willing to die for them.
Wait a minute. Is that why you were to be executed? Because of a woman?
[laughs]
That's it, isn't it? That's it!
It is close to sunset.
You painted old hound, who was she? The mullah's daughter? Another man's wife? What's her name?
Is there no sun in this cursed country? Which way is East?
Her name.
East!
Her name.
Jasmina.

[points]
That way.
Now I have heard that Robin Hood may still be alive. Either tell me where he may be hiding, or you wll all hanged and we will catch him anyway and do the same thing to him.
I'd love to kill him for you.
Will, no!
So he is alive, then?
I'm not really sure.
Then why would I need you?
Because, my lord, if he is alive, I can get close to him. I'm one of his men. He would never suspect me.
He knows you always hated him, traitor!
Shut up!
He's a trusting fool. He'll believe me. And if he doesn't, he'll kill me. Then you've lost nothing.
If you fail, I will personally remove your lying tongue.
And if I succeed, I get my freedom and the bounty on his head.
The lash, I think! Sorry about that. It'll make it more convincing.

[after he stabs Sir Guy of Gisborn]
At least I didn't use a spoon.
How is it, that a once-arrogant young nobleman has found contentment, living rough with the salt of the earth?

I've seen knights in armor panic at the first hint of battle. And I've seen the lowliest, unarmed squire pull a spear from his own body, to defend a dying horse. Nobility is not a birthright. It's defined by one's actions.
Do you mind Locksley? We've just been married.
The hospitality in this country is as warm as the weather.
[talking about how many men that are about to be ambushed]
How many?

[further away]
How many?

[to Azeem]
He can't count anyway.
You came for me... You're alive...
I would die for you.
No man controls my destiny... especially not one who attacks downwind and stinks of garlic.
I had to try.
*I* would have succeeded.
Might I have the pleasure of your name, before I have you run through?
[coming to a wide river]
In my dreams alone have I imagined such a place.
Then imagine a way to cross it.
There is a price on your head.
How much?
One hundred gold pieces.
Is that all? I shall have to annoy the good Sheriff more. Soon it will be a thousand.
For a thousand, I would turn you in myself.
Robin, do something for me.
What?
Take a bath.
Are you bleedin' cracked, girl? You'd get hurt.
I've given birth to eight babies. Don't you talk to me about gettin' hurt, ya big ox.
Who told you to cover up?
[the Sheriff is preparing to rape Marian to impregnate her, even as Robin and Azeem are trying to break down the door]
I can't do this with all that racket!
What a beautiful child. So young, so alive, so unaware of how precarious life can be. I had a very sad childhood, I'll tell you about it sometime. I never knew my parents; it's amazing I'm sane.
Marian, our union would allow these children to grow up as my allies. You understand... I cannot allow them to grow up as my enemies.
I have no choice.
That's true.
Men speak conveniently of love when it serves their purpose.
And you. You travel ten thousand miles to save my life and leave me to be butchered.
I fulfill my vows when I choose to.
Which does not include prayer time, meal time, or any time I'm outnumbered six to one.
You whine like a mule. You are still alive.
...recruit the beasts that share our god.
Animals?
From the North.
You mean... CELTS. They drink the blood of their dead.
Yoke their strength.
Hired thugs... Ahh brilliant.

It was your anger that drove them apart! It's not a lie! You ruined my life! I have more reason to hate you than anyone. But I found myself daring to believe you. What I want to know brother, is will you stay with us and finish what you've started?
I have a brother? I have a brother!
[hugs and holds Will]
So I'll stand with you, side by side. Until the end.
Until the end!
We are all bloody in!
Damn buggers!
We finish this.
[Robin is holding a struggling Little John by the neck in a river]
Do you yield?
I can't bloody swim.
Do you yield?
Yes.
Good. Now put your feet down.
Curse those Moors and Saracens. If it wasn't for their ungodly ways, master Robin would never have left. What manner of name is Azeem? Irish, Cornish?
Moorish.
[Azeem has delivered Fanny's breech baby]
You truly are a great one.
Harboring felons, are you, milady?
They're thieves, you imbecile. They're stealing my horses.
Lucky they didn't steal your virtue as well.
This is English courage.
Let us open a bottle and do our best to save each other's souls.
Alas, I am not permitted.
Fine then, you talk, I'll drink.
[after causing Robin to fall in the river]
There was a rich man from Nottingham/ who tried to cross a river/ What a dope/ he tripped on a rope/ Now look at him shiver. Beg for mercy, rich man.
I beg of no man, as you can see I have nothing, not even my sword.
Any man who travels with two servants and says he has no money, is either a fool or a liar.
Yeah, he's a liar.
[Robin has been knocked down once by John Little]
Any suggestions?
Get up. Move faster.
Move faster. Great idea.
Do you yield?
I'd rather roast in hell.
You were to use this information to get close to me and then kill me, isn't that right, Will? What are your intentions?

Well, that depends on you Locksley. I've never trusted you, that's no secret. What I wanna know is, is are you gonna finish what you started? I want to know if he's gonna turn and run like the spoiled little rich boy I always took him for.
Did I wrong you in another life, Will Scarlett? Where does this intolerable hatred for me come from?
From knowing that... that our father loved you more than me.
Our father?
We are brothers, Robin of Locksley. I am the son of the woman who replaced your dead mother for a time.
It's a lie!

It was your anger that drove them apart! It's not a lie! You ruined my life! I have more reason to hate you than anyone. Yet I found myself daring to believe in you. And what I want to know brother, is will you stay with us and finish what you started?
Step into the light. Turn around.
Am I to dance next?
No. I'll do that. You cover us with your bow.
No Will. It's too dangerous.
So is your aim.
For England!

[holding Robin Hood back]
Come my friend! Make his sacrifice an act of honor! Come now.
It's interesting to hear you say that.
I didn't. My father did.
Did the holy quest erase your hatred of him?

I don't know. All I know is that our last words in this world were spoken in anger. I was lost after my mother died. My father too, and for a short time he found comfort in the arms of another woman, a peasant woman. I thought he was betraying my mother's memory.
So he gave her up?
For the love of a twelve-year-old boy who would never forgive him.
Marian, I've returned to my home to find it destroyed, and my father murdered! And the only clues to why are in the ramblings of an old blind man.
But all I remember of you is a spoiled bully who used to burn my hair as a child.
Please allow that years of war and imprisonment may change a man.
Robin, whatever happened between you and your father, you mustn't believe... what they accused him of.
I don't.

[singing drunkenly]
Old King Richard's gone to war, loves his wine and warring/But for those of us who stay at home, there's only beer and whoring/Play the music, dance the day, think not on tomorrow...
FRIAR! I'm sure you shall find it much more difficult to sing with a sword in your gullet!
Yes, my lord.
[laughs, to himself]
You pig.
[Azeem is preparing to help Fanny deliver a breech baby]
What are you going to do?
I have seen it many times... with horses.
With *horses*?
[preparing to ambush two travelers in the forest]
You take the one on the left.
Which one's left?
[Bull wiggles his right hand]
Oh... which one are you taking?
What do you mean, which one am I taking? If you're taking the one on the left, I'm taking the one on the right.
Which one's right?
The one that...
[he pauses, confused]
We'll just jump out together.
[after Sarah and Marian get the better of Bull and his companion, they bring them to meet Robin]
What happened to your eye, Bull?
We were set upon by, like, ten...
15 large, big lads.
Oh, yeah?
Yeah!
[the outlaws are passing a jug of mead around a circle; one of them finishes, then starts to pass the bottle past Azeem]
Has English hospitality changed so much that a friend of mine's not welcome?
But he's a savage, sire.
That he is... but no more than you or I. And don't call me sire.
[the woodsman offers the jug to Azeem]
Regretfully, I must decline. Allah forbids it.
Your bloody loss, mate.
[first lines]
Show them the courage of Allah!
C'mon, damn you! There're only three of them!
It's not the men we fear, sir. It's the evil spirits.
Robin of the Hood! Son of a devil worshipper! Your father died a coward, cursing your name and squealling like a stuck pig!
You will bring no justice to your father by dying today.
Point me towards danger, Azeem, I'm ready!
[speaking of his father]
He called the Crusades a foolish quest. He said it was vanity to force our religion upon other men.

[after restraining Marian at daggerpoint]
I've never seen the breasts of a noblewoman before.
My father was no devil worshiper. And I'll have words with any man who says otherwise. But he's right. I was a rich man's son. When I killed the sheriff's men, I became an outlaw like you.
You are nothing like us.
[leaves]

That is Will Scarlet. Take no notice of him, he's full of piss and wind. Come on lads, drink up. Don't talk about so much bloody rubbish. This here is the best that we simple men can expect. Here we're safe. We are kings!
[after Robin defeats Little John, and asks for his father's medallion back]
Give me your name first.
Robin of Locksley.
[the camera shifts to Will Scarlet, whose face suddenly clouds over]
Well, Robin of Locksley, you've got balls of solid rock.
Something vexes thee?
